panels.description: A ratio from 0 to 1 of the load on a component. A value of 0 would indicate a completely idle component that is simply waiting for input. A value of 1 would indicate a that is never idle. This value is updated every 5 seconds.

targets.expr: vector_utilization { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }

panels.title: Utilization

panels.description: The rate of bytes processed by the component.

targets.expr: rate(vector_processed_bytes_total{ component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Processed bytes rate

panels.description: The rate of events emitted by this component.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_sent_events_total{ component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component received bytes rate

panels.description: The rate of events accepted by this component either from tagged origins like file and uri, or cumulatively from other origins.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_received_events_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component received events rate

panels.description: The rate of event bytes accepted by this component either from tagged origins like file and uri, or cumulatively from other origins.

targets.expr: rate(vector_component_received_event_bytes_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Component received event bytes rate

panels.description:
A histogram of the number of events passed in each internal batch in Vector’s internal topology.

Note that this is separate than sink-level batching. It is mostly useful for low level debugging performance issues in Vector due to small internal batches.

targets.expr: vector_component_received_events_count{ component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }

targets.expr: vector_http_client_response_rtt_seconds { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }

panels.title: Client response RTT seconds

panels.description: The total number of HTTP 400 Bad Request errors encountered.

targets.expr: rate(vector_http_bad_requests_total { host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Bad requests rate

panels.description: The rate of requests sent to Kafka brokers.

targets.expr: rate(vector_kafka_requests_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Requests rate

panels.description: The rate of bytes transmitted to Kafka brokers.

targets.expr: rate(vector_kafka_requests_bytes_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Requests bytes rate

panels.description: The rate of responses received from Kafka brokers.

targets.expr: rate(vector_kafka_responses_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Responses rate

panels.description: The rate of bytes received from Kafka brokers.

targets.expr: rate(vector_kafka_responses_bytes_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Responses bytes rate

panels.description: Rate of messages transmitted (produced) to Kafka brokers.

targets.expr: rate(vector_kafka_produced_messages_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Produced messages rate

targets.expr: rate(vector_kafka_produced_messages_bytes_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Produced messages bytes rate

panels.description: Rate of messages consumed, not including ignored messages (due to offset, etc), from Kafka brokers.

targets.expr: rate(vector_kafka_consumed_messages_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Consumed messages rate

panels.description: Rate of message bytes (including framing) received from Kafka brokers.

targets.expr: rate(vector_kafka_consumed_messages_bytes_total { component_id =~ "$component_id", component_type =~ "$component_type", component_kind =~ "$component_kind", host =~ "$host", pid =~ "$pid", job =~ "$job", instance =~ "$instance" }[$__rate_interval])

panels.title: Consumed messages bytes rate
